An array list of objects in the returned collection.
Array list of standard operating hours for each day of the week this location is open for shopper business.
The Friday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Fridays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Monday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Mondays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Saturday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Saturdays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Sunday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Sundays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Thursday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Thursdays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Tuesday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Tuesdays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.
The Wednesday label array describes the range of hours this location is normally open on Wednesdays. For example: {"Label": "10:00 AM - 6:00 PM"}.

An attribute value type is either predefined vocabulary by the admin during product attribute set up or it can be "AdminEntered" or "ShopperEntered". The difference between predefined values versus manually entered values is such that the first choice is a set of options to choose from. AdminEntered and ShopperEntered are values that are entered rather than system-supplied and are not stored in the database, but captured during a live commerce operations such as during an order.

Discount used to calculate SalePrice. Includes coupon code if applicable, amount of the discount, and discount savings. Discounts can be either an absolute price or a percentage off. The sale price beats any discounts.
The integer amount of the discount. For example, an entry of "10" could represent a discount of $10.00 or a discount of 10%, depending on the type.
The type of discount amount, such as an amount or a percentage.
The most recent number of redeemed discounts.

The scope to which the discount applies, which is "Order" for order discounts or "LineItem" for individual product discounts.
Current status of the product discount. Possible values are "Active", "Scheduled", or "Expired".

Specifies what to discount such as the type of discount and which products, categories, or shipping methods are eligible for the discount. Discount types can include the percentage off, specific monetary amount, or free shipping. This parameter also specifies the minimum monetary amount that the order must meet for the discount to apply.

Array list of products to exclude for this discount.

Properties of the category, price, or attribute facet shoppers use to filter product display results on a storefront.
Unique identifier for the storefront container used to organize products.
Unique identifier of the facet.
The type of facet. Valid values are "range," which enables creation of a range of values, or "value," which populates the facet values based on the associated attribute or category.
If true, disables a facet inherited from a parent category.
The numeric sequence of the facet for its associated category.
Overrides a facet inherited from a parent category for a specified subcategory. System-supplied and read only.

Container for the facet source information, which includes the category, price, or attribute properties.
System-supplied and read only parameter that validates a facet for its associated category.
For range type facets, a single range of facet values. For example, a price facet might have a $0-$25 range query.
The maximum value to use for the facet range query.
The minimum value to use for the facet range query.

The list of subcategories and attributes that have not been defined as facets for the category.
The list of category, price, and attribute facets defined for the category.
Container for the facet source information, which includes the category, price, or attribute properties.
If true, the facet allows for values that consist of one or more ranges, such as 0-100, 100-200, and 200-300.
The data type associated with the attribute or category that generates the facet, such as bool or string.
Identifier of the facet source, which is attribute, category, or price. For attribute facets, the AttributeFQN.
System-supplied and read-only name of the associated facet source.
The source type for the facet, either "Attribute" or "Element". Category and price facets are elements.
System-supplied and read only parameter that validates a facet for its associated category.
If true, the facet source is valid for its associated category.
Code associated with a reason for facet validation to return false for its associated category.

The type of inventory adjustment to perform, which is "Absolute" or "Delta". If adjusting by an absolute value, enter the integer in the Value parameter. If adjusting by a delta value, enter the delta in the Value parameter.

Value of the location inventory adjustment, which is an absolute integer or delta. For example, to decrease the current inventory level by 2, set the Type parameter to "Delta" and the Value parameter to "-2". To adjust the inventory to a current level of 12, set the Type parameter to "Absolute" and the Value parameter to "12".

Properties of the product such as product code, product name, and product price.
Merchant-generated product code for the product that any variation stems from.

If true, the product has configurable options. This option means that a product is not purchasable until the shopper selects options that resolve into a product variation. Configurable options for a product are the choices a shopper makes when ordering a product. Size and color are configurable options. System-supplied and read-only.
If true, this product has stand alone options that a shopper can select which can exist without product variations. Stand alone options. System-supplied and read-only.
If true, the product must be packaged on its own and should not be jointly packaged with other products.

If true, the product can be purchased or fulfilled at regular intervals such as a monthly billing cycle or a digital or physical subscription. This property is reserved for future functionality and is system-supplied and read only.
If true, the entity is subject to tax based on the relevant tax rate.
If true, the entity is valid for the product type provided.
If true, the product in this request is a product variation of a product that has configurable options. System-supplied and read-only.
Merchant-created code that uniquely identifies the product such as a SKU or item number. Once created, the product code is read-only.
Integer that represents the sequential order of the product.

Properties of an extra attribute to defined for a product that is associated with a product type that uses the extra. Setting up extras for a product enables shopper-entered information, such as initials for a monogram.
The fully qualified name of the attribute, which is a user defined attribute identifier.
If true, the shopper can select more than one value from a predefined list for this extra.
If true, the shopper must select the product extra and specify a value for it during checkout.
The list of predefined values a shopper can select for the product when defining this extra.
Properties of a defined value for a product extra attribute.
The difference between the weight associated with this product extra and the base product. For example, if a product with a monogram weighs an extra 1/4 lb, the DeltaWeight value is "0.25".
If true, the value for the product extra is selected by default. Shopper entered extras cannot be defaulted.
Properties of a defined value for a product extra attribute.
Detail of the product extra attribute vocabulary value.

The difference between the price associated with this product extra and the base product. For example, if a product with a defined monogram extra costs an additional $10, the DeltaPrice value is "10".
The properties of the price difference between the product extra and the base product.
3-letter ISO 4217 standard global currency code. Currently, only "USD" (US Dollar) is supported.

The difference between the price associated with this product extra and the base product. For example, if a product with a defined monogram extra costs an additional $10, the DeltaPrice value is "10".
Properties of a product associated with a specific catalog.
If true, the product is actively available (for sale) in the associated catalog.

If true, the content defined for this product in the master catalog in overridden in the catalog with the content specified in the request body. If false, this catalog uses the content defined in the master catalog for the product.

If true, the price defined for this product in the master catalog in overridden in the catalog with the price specified in the request body. If false, this catalog uses the price defined in the master catalog for the product.

If true, the SEO content defined for this product in the master catalog in overridden in the catalog with the SEO content specified in the request body. If false, this catalog uses the SEO content defined in the master catalog for the product.
Identifier and datetime stamp information recorded when a user or application creates, updates, or deletes a resource entity. This value is system-supplied and read-only.

Localizable content for a product associated with a specific catalog. If no catalog-level content is specified, the master catalog content is used. To override content at the catalog level, the IsContentOverridden flag must be set to "true".

The price of the product associated with the specified catalog. If no price is specified in the request, this catalog uses the price defined in the master catalog. To override the product price for this catalog, the IsPriceOverridden flag must be set to "true".
The product categories to define for the product associated with the specified catalog.

The SEO content of the product associated with the specific catalog. If no SEO content is specified in the request, this catalog uses the SEO content defined in the master catalog. To override the SEO content for this catalog, the IsSEOContentOverridden flag must be set to "true".
Properties of the inventory behavior associated with a product definition.
If true, Mozu manages inventory levels for this product.

Determines the method this product uses when active stock is depeleted. Options are "DisplayMessage" to display an out of stock message to the shopper, "HideProduct" to disable the product on the storefront, or "AllowBackOrder" to allow the shopper to back order the product. This property is required only if Mozu manages inventory for this product.
The localized product content in the language specified by the LocaleCode.
Language used for the entity. Currently, only "en-US" is supported.
More detailed or full product description typically used for a product details page.
The descriptive brief product name.

The user ID of the user who last published changes for this product in the catalog.
The date and time a draft change for this product was published to the catalog.

The current publishing state of this product in the catalog, which is Live, New, or Draft. Live products appear on the storefront and have no pending changes. New products have been created but do not yet appear on the storefront. Draft products appear on the storefront but have pending changes that have not yet been published.

The difference between the base weight for a product and this variation of the product, which can be a positive or negative decimal value.
If true, this variation of this product is marked available for sale.

If true, the production variation is no longer available for sale. For example, if a merchant stops selling all "small" shirts, all product variations with the "small" option are set to IsOrphan. System-supplied and read-only.
If true, one or more product variations are configured for the specified product code.
System-generated key that represents the attribute values that uniquely identify a specific product variation.
Merchant-created code associated with a specific product variation. Variation product codes maintain an association with the base product code.

The difference between the base price for the product and this variation of the product, which can be a positive or negative decimal value. For example, if the base price for a t-shirt product is $10, but the XL variation should cost $12, the DeltaPrice value should be "2". However, if the XS variation should only cost $8, the DeltaPrice value should be "-2".
Wrapper for the list of option attributes configured for the product variation.
Collection of variations configured for a product.

However, if the XS variation should only cost $8, the DeltaPrice value should be "-2".

General settings used on the storefront site.
If true, the site allows entry of addresses not verified by an address validation service.
The physical directory path or URL where the mobile favicon image file is stored. The favicon icon is generally 57x57 pixels. The icon appears on a mobile website or on the mobile device's OS Home.

The physical directory path or URL where the mobile favicon image file is stored. The favicon icon is generally 16x16 pixels. The icon appears on a a browser tab as the website's mini logo or on a browser address bar, or next to the page name in a list of bookmarks.
The Google Analytics code associated with a particular store. This could be the web tracking code.

The type of customer checking out in the order such as a guest who has not logged in or a customer who has logged in. Valid strings are either "LoginOptional," where shoppers are prompted to sign in but are not required to do so, or "LoginRequired," where shopppers must login before purchasing.

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource
member.summary: Use the Carts resource to manage storefront shopping carts as items are added and removed. Each time a shopper's cart is modified, the Carts resource updates the estimated total with any applicable discounts.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.GetCart(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the cart specified in the request.
member.param: Identifier of the cart to retrieve.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cart = cart.GetCart( cartId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.GetOrCreateCart
member.summary: Retrieves a cart's contents for the current shopper. If the shopper does not have an active cart on the site, the service creates one.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cart = cart.GetOrCreateCart();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.GetCartSummary
member.summary: Retrieves summary information associated with the cart of the current shopper, including the number of items, the current total, and whether the cart has expired. All anonymous idle carts that do not proceed to checkout expire after 14 days.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cartSummary = cart.GetCartSummary();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.GetUserCart(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the cart of the user specified in the request.
member.param: Unique identifier of the user whose cart you want to retrieve.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cart = cart.GetUserCart( userId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.GetUserCartSummary(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves summary information associated with the cart of user specified in the request, including the number of items in the cart, the current total, and whether the cart has expired. All anonymous idle carts that do not proceed to checkout expire after 14 days.
member.param: Unique identifier of the user whose cart details you want to retrieve.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cartSummary = cart.GetUserCartSummary( userId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.UpdateCart(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Carts.Cart)
member.summary: Update the current shopper's cart.
member.param: All of the properties of the cart to update. The product code is required.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); var cart = cart.UpdateCart( cart);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.DeleteCart(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the cart specified in the request.
member.param: Identifier of the cart to delete.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); cart.DeleteCart( cartId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.CartResource.DeleteCurrentCart
member.summary: Deletes the cart of the currently active shopper.

example.code: var cart = new Cart(); cart.DeleteCurrentCart();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Carts.ChangeMessageResource.RemoveMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a single message associated with the cart of the current shopper.
member.param: Identifier of the message to remove from the cart.

example.code: var changemessage = new ChangeMessage(); changemessage.RemoveMessage( messageId);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Admin.Attributedefinition.AttributeResource
member.summary: Use the Attribute Definition resource to manage the properties, options, and extras that uniquely describe products of a specific type. Attributes can be associated with a product type, assigned values by a merchant or shopper, and added as faceted search filters for a product category. Options are product attributes that describe unique configurations made by the shopper, such as size or color, and generate a new product variation (or unique SKU). Properties are product attributes that describe aspects of the product that do not represent an option configurable by the shopper, such as screen resolution or brand. Extras are product attributes that describe add-on configurations made by the shopper that do not represent a product variation, such as a monogram.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Admin.Attributedefinition.AttributeResource.GetAttributes(Mozu.Api.DataViewMode)
member.summary: Retrieves a paged list of attributes according to any specified filter criteria and sort options.

example.code: var attribute = new Attribute(); var attributeCollection = attribute.GetAttributes(dataViewMode);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Admin.Attributedefinition.AttributeResource.GetAttributes(Mozu.Api.DataViewMode,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a paged list of attributes according to any specified filter criteria and sort options.
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.

example.code: var attribute = new Attribute(); var attributeCollection = attribute.GetAttributes(dataViewMode, startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Admin.Attributedefinition.ProductTypeResource
member.summary: Use the Product Types resource to manage the types for your product catalog. Product types act as configuration templates, which store a set of attributes common to all products associated with that type. Unlike categories, products can only be associated with a single product type.

member.summary: Generates the variations possible for a product associated with the product type based on the option values supplied in the request.
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
Unique identifier of the product type.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.
The product option attributes configured for this product type.

example.code: var producttypevariation = new ProductTypeVariation(); var productVariationPagedCollection = producttypevariation.GenerateProductVariations(dataViewMode, productOptionsIn, productTypeId, productCode, startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Storefront.ProductSearchResultResource
member.summary: Provide dynamic search results to shoppers as they browse and search for products on the storefront. Suggest possible search terms as the shopper enters text.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Catalog.Storefront.ProductSearchResultResource.Search
member.summary: Searches the categories displayed on the storefront for products or product options that the shopper types in a search query.

example.code: var productsearchresult = new ProductSearchResult(); var productSearchResult = productsearchresult.Search();

member.summary: Searches the categories displayed on the storefront for products or product options that the shopper types in a search query.
member.param: Individually list the facet fields you want to display in a storefront product search.
Display a range facet not specified in a template in a storefront product search by listing the facet field and the range to display.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the number of category hierarchy levels to return for the facet. This option is only available for category facets.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the parent categories you want to skip in the storefront product search. This parameter is only available for category facets.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the category in the hierarchy to begin faceting on. This parameter is only available for category facets.
The number of facet values to return for one or more facets.
Settings reserved for future facet search functionality on a storefront product search.
When paging through multiple facets, the startIndex value for each facet.

The facet template to use on the storefront. A template displays all facets associated with the template on the storefront product search. Currently, only category-level facet templates are available.
Display a subset of the facets defined in the template specified in facetTemplate parameter.
The facet values to apply to the filter.

A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. You can filter product search results by any of its properties, including product code, type, category, and name. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=categoryId+eq+12"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
The terms to search on.

example.code: var productsearchresult = new ProductSearchResult(); var productSearchResult = productsearchresult.Search( query, filter, facetTemplate, facetTemplateSubset, facet, facetFieldRangeQuery, facetHierPrefix, facetHierValue, facetHierDepth, facetStartIndex, facetPageSize, facetSettings, facetValueFilter, sortBy, pageSize, startIndex);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.ChannelResource
member.summary: Use the Channels resource to manage the channels a company uses to create logical commercial business divisions based on region or types of sales, such as "US Online," "Amazon," or "EMEA Retail." All orders include a channel association that enables the company to perform financial reporting for each defined channel. Because channels are managed at the tenant level, you must associate all the tenant's sites with a channel. Sites that do not have a defined channel association cannot successfully submit orders.

For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

example.code: var visit = new Visit(); var visitCollection = visit.GetVisits( startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource
member.summary: Use the Orders resource to manage all components of order processing, payment, and fulfillment.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource.GetOrders
member.summary: Retrieves a list of orders according to any specified filter criteria and sort options.

example.code: var order = new Order(); var orderCollection = order.GetOrders();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource.GetOrders(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Retrieves a list of orders according to any specified filter criteria and sort options.
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. You can filter an order's search results by any of its properties, including status, contact information, or total. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=Status+eq+Submitted"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
A list of order search terms to use in the query when searching across order number and the name or email of the billing contact. Separate multiple search terms with a space character.
The maximum number of search results to return in the response. You can limit any range between 1-100.

example.code: var order = new Order(); var orderCollection = order.GetOrders( startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter, q, qLimit);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource.UpdateOrderDiscount(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Discounts.AppliedDiscount,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update the properties of a discount applied to an order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the discount. System-supplied and read only.
Unique identifier of the order discount. System-supplied and read only.
Properties of the order discount to update.

example.code: var order = new Order(); var order = order.UpdateOrderDiscount( discount, orderId, discountId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource.UpdateOrderDiscount(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Discounts.AppliedDiscount,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Update the properties of a discount applied to an order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the discount. System-supplied and read only.
Unique identifier of the order discount. System-supplied and read only.

Specifies whether to modify the discount by updating the original order, updating the order in draft mode, or updating the order in draft mode and then committing the changes to the original. Draft mode enables users to make incremental order changes before committing the changes to the original order. Valid values are "ApplyToOriginal," "ApplyToDraft," or "ApplyAndCommit."

System-supplied integer that represents the current version of the order, which prevents users from unintentionally overriding changes to the order. When a user performs an operation for a defined order, the system validates that the version of the updated order matches the version of the order on the server. After the operation completes successfully, the system increments the version number by one.
Properties of the order discount to update.

example.code: var order = new Order(); var order = order.UpdateOrderDiscount( discount, orderId, discountId, updateMode, version);

example.code: var order = new Order(); order.DeleteOrderDraft( orderId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.OrderResource.DeleteOrderDraft(System.String,System.String)

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.FulfillmentActionResource
member.summary: Use the Fulfillment resource to manage shipments or pickups of collections of packages for an order.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.FulfillmentActionResource.PerformFulfillmentAction(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Fulfillment.FulfillmentAction,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the fulfillment action to "Ship" or "PickUp". To ship an order or prepare it for in-store pickup, the order must have a customer name, the "Open" or "OpenAndProcessing" status. To ship the order, it must also have the full shipping address and shipping method. Shipping all packages or picking up all pickups for an order will complete a paid order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order for which to perform the fulfillment action.
The action to perform for the order fulfillment.

example.code: var fulfillmentaction = new FulfillmentAction(); var order = fulfillmentaction.PerformFulfillmentAction( action, orderId);

member.param: If true, retrieve the draft version of the order's fulfillment information, which might include uncommitted changes.
Unique identifier of the order.

example.code: var fulfillmentinfo = new FulfillmentInfo(); var fulfillmentInfo = fulfillmentinfo.GetFulfillmentInfo( orderId, draft);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.FulfillmentInfo.FulfillmentInfoResource.SetFulFillmentInfo(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Fulfillment.FulfillmentInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Updates one or more properties of fulfillment information for the specified order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order.
Array list of fulfillment information associated with an order.

example.code: var fulfillmentinfo = new FulfillmentInfo(); var fulfillmentInfo = fulfillmentinfo.SetFulFillmentInfo( fulfillmentInfo, orderId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.FulfillmentInfo.FulfillmentInfoResource.SetFulFillmentInfo(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Fulfillment.FulfillmentInfo,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates one or more properties of fulfillment information for the specified order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order.

Specifies whether to set the fulfillment information by updating the original order, updating the order in draft mode, or updating the order in draft mode and then committing the changes to the original. Draft mode enables users to make incremental order changes before committing the changes to the original order. Valid values are "ApplyToOriginal," "ApplyToDraft," or "ApplyAndCommit."

System-supplied integer that represents the current version of the order, which prevents users from unintentionally overriding changes to the order. When a user performs an operation for a defined order, the system validates that the version of the updated order matches the version of the order on the server. After the operation completes successfully, the system increments the version number by one.
Array list of fulfillment information associated with an order.

example.code: var fulfillmentinfo = new FulfillmentInfo(); var fulfillmentInfo = fulfillmentinfo.SetFulFillmentInfo( fulfillmentInfo, orderId, updateMode, version);

After the operation completes successfully, the system increments the version number by one.

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource
member.summary: Use the Payments subresource to manage payment transactions for orders. Each transaction performed for an order represents an individual payment. For example, if an order totals $75.00 but the shopper has a $50.00 gift certificate, both the gift certificate transaction and the credit card transaction for the remaining $25.00 are recorded as payments for the order.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource.GetPayments(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information about all payment transactions submitted for the specified order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order.

example.code: var payment = new Payment(); var paymentCollection = payment.GetPayments( orderId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource.GetPayment(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specific payment transaction submitted for the specified order.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order associated with the payment transaction.
Unique identifier of the payment transaction submitted for the order.

example.code: var payment = new Payment(); var payment = payment.GetPayment( orderId, paymentId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource.GetAvailablePaymentActions(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of all available payment actions dependent on the order payment status by specifying the order ID.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order associated with the payment.
Unique identifer of the payment for which to retrieve available actions.

example.code: var payment = new Payment(); var string = payment.GetAvailablePaymentActions( orderId, paymentId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource.PerformPaymentAction(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Payments.PaymentAction,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the specified action for an individual order payment transaction.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order associated with the payment.
Unique identifer of the payment for which to perform the action.
The action to perform for the payment. Possible values are AuthAndCapture, AuthorizePayment, CapturePayment, VoidPayment, CreditPayment, RequestCheck, ApplyCheck, DeclineCheck.

example.code: var payment = new Payment(); var order = payment.PerformPaymentAction( action, orderId, paymentId);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Orders.PaymentResource.CreatePaymentAction(Mozu.Api.Contracts.CommerceRuntime.Payments.PaymentAction,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new payment transaction for the specified order and performs the specified action.
member.param: Unique identifier of the order for which to apply the payment.
To action to perform for the newly created payment. Possible values are AuthAndCapture, AuthorizePayment, CapturePayment, VoidPayment, CreditPayment, RequestCheck, ApplyCheck, DeclineCheck.

example.code: var payment = new Payment(); var order = payment.CreatePaymentAction( action, orderId);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.ReturnResource
member.summary: Use the returns subresource to manage returned items that were previously fufilled. Returns can include any number of items associated with an original Mozu order. Each return must either be associated with an original order or a product definition to represent each returned item.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.ReturnResource.GetReturns
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all returns according to any filter and sort criteria.

example.code: var return = new Return(); var returnCollection = return.GetReturns();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.ReturnResource.GetReturns(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all returns according to any filter and sort criteria.
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

example.code: var return = new Return(); var returnCollection = return.GetReturns( startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Settings.LocationUsageResource
member.summary: Use the Location Usages resource to define the locations and location types that interact with the specified site. The system creates three default location usage types for each site after provisioning a new tenant - one for direct ship (DS), one for in-store pickup (SP), and one for store finder (storeFinder). Each site can only use a single location for the direct ship location usage type, and the location must support the direct ship fulfillment type (DS). For the in-store pickup location usage type, each site can use one or more location types. The location service identifies all locations of the specified type that support the in-store pickup fulfillment type (SP). For the store finder location usage type, each site can use one or more location types. The location service identifies all locations of the type. Locations configured for the store finder type do not typically maintain inventory. You cannot create additional location usage types at this time.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Settings.LocationUsageResource.GetLocationUsages
member.summary: Retrieves the configured site location usages for the location usage code specified in the request.

member.param: Code that identifies the location usage type, which is "DS" for direct ship, "SP" for in-store pickup, or "storeFinder" for store finder.

example.code: var locationusage = new LocationUsage(); var locationUsage = locationusage.GetLocationUsage( code);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.Settings.LocationUsageResource.UpdateLocationUsage(Mozu.Api.Contracts.Location.LocationUsage,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the location usage for the site based on the location usage code specified in the request.

Properties of the location usage type to update.

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.WishlistResource
member.summary: Use the Wish Lists resource to manage the shopper wish lists of products associated with a customer account. Although customer accounts are managed at the tenant level, the system stores shopper wish lists at the site level. This enables the same customer to have wish lists for each of a merchant's sites. Use the Wish List Items resource to manage items in a wish list.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.WishlistResource.GetWishlists
member.summary: Retrieves a list of shopper wish lists according to any filter and sort criteria.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Commerce.WishlistResource.GetWishlists(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Retrieves a list of shopper wish lists according to any filter and sort criteria.
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
A list of search terms to use in the query when searching across wish list name. Separate multiple search terms with a space character.
The maximum number of search results to return in the response. You can limit any range between 1-100.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

example.code: var wishlist = new Wishlist(); var wishlistCollection = wishlist.GetWishlists( startIndex, pageSize, sortBy, filter, q, qLimit);

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Content.Documentlists.DocumentResource.GetDocuments(Mozu.Api.DataViewMode,System.String)

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Content.Documentlists.DocumentResource.GetDocuments(Mozu.Api.DataViewMode,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of documents according to any filter and sort criteria.
member.param: The name of the document list.

A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. You can filter a document's search results by any of its properties, including its name or folder path. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=Name+sw+Events"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

example.code: var document = new Document(); var documentCollection = document.GetDocuments(dataViewMode, documentListName, filter, sortBy, pageSize, startIndex);

member.name: T:Mozu.Api.Resources.Platform.ReferenceDataResource
member.summary: The Reference resource retrieves collections of standards the Mozu system currently supports. This includes content locales, top-level domains, units of measure, countries, currencies, time zones, and shipping or billing address schemas.

member.summary: Retrieves a specific address schema based on the country code provided. This operation allows the creation of custom shipping and billing address fields.

example.code: var referencedata = new ReferenceData(); var addressSchema = referencedata.GetAddressSchema();

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Resources.Platform.ReferenceDataResource.GetAddressSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a specific address schema based on the country code provided. This operation allows the creation of custom shipping and billing address fields.

member.summary: Get Resource Url for GenerateProductVariations
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
Unique identifier of the product type.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

Get Resource Url for Search
member.param: Individually list the facet fields you want to display in a storefront product search.
Display a range facet not specified in a template in a storefront product search by listing the facet field and the range to display.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the number of category hierarchy levels to return for the facet. This option is only available for category facets.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the parent categories you want to skip in the storefront product search. This parameter is only available for category facets.
If filtering using category facets in a hierarchy, the category in the hierarchy to begin faceting on. This parameter is only available for category facets.
The number of facet values to return for one or more facets.
Settings reserved for future facet search functionality on a storefront product search.
When paging through multiple facets, the startIndex value for each facet.

The facet template to use on the storefront. A template displays all facets associated with the template on the storefront product search. Currently, only category-level facet templates are available.
Display a subset of the facets defined in the template specified in facetTemplate parameter.
The facet values to apply to the filter.

A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. You can filter product search results by any of its properties, including product code, type, category, and name. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=categoryId+eq+12"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
The terms to search on.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Urls.Commerce.Orders.AdjustmentUrl.ApplyShippingAdjustmentUrl(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Resource Url for ApplyShippingAdjustment
member.param: Unique identifier of the order associated with the shipping adjustment.

Specifies whether to apply the shipping adjustment by updating the original order, updating the order in draft mode, or updating the order in draft mode and then committing the changes to the original. Draft mode enables users to make incremental order changes before committing the changes to the original order. Valid values are "ApplyToOriginal," "ApplyToDraft," or "ApplyAndCommit."

System-supplied integer that represents the current version of the order, which prevents users from unintentionally overriding changes to the order. When a user performs an operation for a defined order, the system validates that the version of the updated order matches the version of the order on the server. After the operation completes successfully, the system increments the version number by one.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Urls.Commerce.Orders.Attributedefinition.AttributeUrl.GetAttributesUrl(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Get Resource Url for GetAttributes
member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.

The property by which to sort results and whether the results appear in ascending (a-z) order, represented by ASC or in descending (z-a) order, represented by DESC. The sortBy parameter follows an available property. For example: "sortBy=productCode+asc"

When creating paged results from a query, this value indicates the zero-based offset in the complete result set where the returned entities begin. For example, with a PageSize of 25, to get the 51st through the 75th items, use startIndex=3.

member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. You can filter an order's search results by any of its properties, including status, contact information, or total. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=Status+eq+Submitted"
The number of results to display on each page when creating paged results from a query. The maximum value is 200.
A list of order search terms to use in the query when searching across order number and the name or email of the billing contact. Separate multiple search terms with a space character.
The maximum number of search results to return in the response. You can limit any range between 1-100.

member.name: M:Mozu.Api.Urls.Commerce.OrderUrl.UpdateOrderDiscountUrl(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Resource Url for UpdateOrderDiscount
member.param: Unique identifier of the discount. System-supplied and read only.
Unique identifier of the order discount. System-supplied and read only.

Specifies whether to modify the discount by updating the original order, updating the order in draft mode, or updating the order in draft mode and then committing the changes to the original. Draft mode enables users to make incremental order changes before committing the changes to the original order. Valid values are "ApplyToOriginal," "ApplyToDraft," or "ApplyAndCommit."

System-supplied integer that represents the current version of the order, which prevents users from unintentionally overriding changes to the order. When a user performs an operation for a defined order, the system validates that the version of the updated order matches the version of the order on the server. After the operation completes successfully, the system increments the version number by one.

member.param: A set of expressions that consist of a field, operator, and value and represent search parameter syntax when filtering results of a query. Valid operators include equals (eq), does not equal (ne), greater than (gt), less than (lt), greater than or equal to (ge), less than or equal to (le), starts with (sw), or contains (cont). For example - "filter=IsDisplayed+eq+true"
